input: "I am a new customer and I am looking for a great experience.  I was a completely new customer.  I did not have an appointment because my other plans got rained out and my dealership was too busy to take me.  I needed a PA State & Emissions  inspection which I dread because they can be a total ripoff at some places when they add things on and I just wanted to get it over with.  I saw that this place had much better reviews on Yelp than many other shops in the area.  Keystone Discount Tire took my 2008 Pontiac Torrent in for inspection while I waited and had some free coffee.  I only had to get up once to look at some irregular outer front tire wear on my car when it was on the rack during inspection.  I always appreciate it when the technician lets me look at the problem.   It was nothing major.  Easily correctable with an alignment sometime in the future.  Bill was very friendly,

My sole desire was to get this task completed quickly. In my search for a trustworthy shop, I noticed the outstanding reviews on Yelp for Keystone Discount Tire, surpassing those of many other local shops. 

Upon arrival, Keystone Discount Tire promptly attended to my 2008 Pontiac Torrent for inspection, allowing me to wait comfortably with complimentary coffee. The only interruption occurred when I had to briefly inspect an irregularity in the outer front tire wear while my car was on the rack. I genuinely appreciate technicians who include me in the process and allow me to observe the issue firsthand. Fortunately, the problem turned out to be minor and easily fixable with a future alignment. Throughout my visit, Bill, the staff member, was exceptionally friendly.

Looking after a human baby requires a lot of love and care. It is important to feed them regularly, provide a clean and safe environment, make sure they are healthy, and give them plenty of attention and stimulation. Here are some basic steps to take care of a baby:

1. Feeding: Babies need to be fed regularly, depending on their age. Newborns usually need to be fed every 2-3 hours, while older babies can go longer between feedings. Breast milk or formula is recommended, and it's important to burp the baby after each feeding to prevent gas and discomfort.

2. Diapering: Babies need to be changed frequently to keep their skin clean and dry. Disposable diapers can be changed as often as needed, while cloth diapers should be changed when they become soiled. It's important to use diaper rash cream or ointment as needed to prevent irritation.

3. Bathing: Babies don't need to be bathed every day, but regular bathing can help keep their skin clean and prevent rashes. Use mild baby soap and warm water, and be careful to support the baby's head and neck during the bath. Make sure to dry the baby thoroughly after the bath to prevent irritation.

4. Sleep: Babies need a lot of sleep, so it's important to provide a safe and comfortable sleeping environment. Use a firm mattress and avoid loose bedding that could suffocate the baby. Place the baby on their back to sleep to reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS). Follow a consistent bedtime routine to help the baby relax and fall asleep.

5. Safety: Babies are curious and can get into unsafe situations quickly. It's important to childproof the home by covering electrical outlets, securing cabinets and drawers, and using safety gates and cabinet locks. Never leave a baby unattended on a high surface or near water, and always use a car seat when traveling.

6. Health: Regular check-ups with a pediatrician are important to monitor the baby's growth and development. Keep up with vaccinations as recommended by the doctor. Look out for any signs of illness, such as fever, cough, or difficulty breathing, and seek medical attention if necessary.

7. Engage with the baby: Babies thrive on attention and interaction. Talk to the baby, sing songs, and play games to help stimulate their growing brain. Provide age-appropriate toys and activities that allow them to explore and learn.

Remember, every baby is different, so it's important to be flexible and attentive to their individual needs. Trust your instincts and seek help or advice when needed.

"I've come from Cali where boba is very common there. However I was thinking this place would have had the same feel. After being told this place branched off from California, I was disappointed. 

I'm more of a natural person. I enjoy real flavor, real fruits, and of course the perfect boba. I notice that some flavors were used by real fruits but others were just powder which I could definitely taste the different. Especially the taro flavor, being one of my favorites. 

But, if you're not too concern about natural vs powder flavor then this place could be good for you. They ask what level you would like you sweetness and any additional add-ons you would like. I always get boba but sometimes the grass jelly is pretty good too! I'd recommend you try. 

This is also a good place to catch up, talk, play board, card games and even do homework. I know

However, if you're not too concerned about natural versus powdered flavors, this place might still be enjoyable for you. They offer a range of sweetness levels and additional add-ons to customize your drink. Personally, I always go for boba, but their grass jelly is also quite tasty. I recommend giving it a try.

input:
I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a good meal in a small space. 

This is a small hole in the wall in the African section of Woodland Avenue.  Though it might not look like much, there is some good food coming out of its kitchen representing Senegal and West Africa.  I enjoyed the national dish of Senegal - Thiboudienne - although note that here they do a version without the usual tomato sauce.  I also took home a Jollof Rice which is often called the mother dish of Jambalaya.  There are a few hightop tables inside for dining or you can order the food to-go.  Either way, service is friendly.  I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a good meal in a small space.

I had a falafel wrap here a few years ago. Not bad, so tried it again today. No flavor, except extreme saltiness! The falafels & pita = no flavor. I was hoping the tzatziki sauce would pull it all together, nope! It had no flavor either. It wasn't like the sauce you'd imagine, but more like a thin tasteless glue. Only good part about the wrap were the fresh diced cucumber & tomato, too bad that was underneath the icky white sauce that doesn't even deserve to be called tzatziki : (

Didn't get one of the tables facing the windows, but still had great views of the sunset and city by night. Again, multiple choices for the three courses, but I chose to start with the crisp peas/ham/garlic risotto [balls]. Main course was the Butcher's Filet (braised short rib + Steuben bean chili, potato/farm veg slaw and basil), which was quite heavy since there was also meat in the chili as well. Revise this with your best effort: On the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place sits a sophisticated and stylish restaurant/lounge, offering a mesmerizing bird's eye view of the city. After a long day of meetings, our group decided to dine together at this remarkable establishment. Although we were not fortunate enough to secure a table facing the windows, we still enjoyed breathtaking views of the sunset and the city's nighttime allure. The menu boasted an array of choices for each of the three courses, and I opted to commence my culinary journey with the delectable peas, ham, and garlic risotto balls. For the main course, I indulged in the tantalizing Butcher's Filet, which consisted of succulent braised short rib alongside Steuben bean chili, accompanied by a delightful potato and farm vegetable slaw infused with basil. This dish provided a hearty, satisfying experience due to the inclusion of meat within the chili. To culminate the evening on a sweet and euphoric note, I savored the dazzling dessert of milk chocolate infused with hints of hazelnut. This heavenly treat was paired with a luscious salted caramel sauce and a warming coffee to delicately melt the velvety chocolate, while candied almonds provided an enticing, crunchy accompaniment. Complementing our delightful meal, we shared a bottle of exquisite wine, enhancing the overall dining experience. The food surpassed our expectations, and the service provided by our waiter was truly exceptional, as he attentively catered to our every need.
Help me polish this:
On the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place sits a breathtakingly elegant restaurant/lounge, offering an unrivaled bird's eye view of the city. After a day filled with meetings, our group decided to dine here together, seeking solace in the beauty of our surroundings. Although we didn't secure one of the coveted tables facing the windows, we were still treated to magnificent views of the sunset and the vibrant city lights at night.

The restaurant featured a diverse menu with numerous options for each course. For my starter, I opted for the tantalizingly delicious crisp peas, ham, and garlic risotto balls. The flavors melded together seamlessly, creating a mouthwatering dish that left me craving more.

Moving on to the main course, I indulged in the succulent Butcher's Filet, accompanied by braised short rib and Steuben bean chili. The rich flavors of the meat were further enhanced by the delightful potato and farm vegetable slaw, accented with hints of basil. Although the dish was undeniably hearty, the addition of meat in the chili made it slightly more substantial.

To conclude the culinary journey, I savored the dazzling dessert of milk chocolate and hazelnut pudding. This delectable treat was served with a luscious salted caramel sauce and a side of perfectly candied almonds. The waitstaff graciously poured hot coffee over the pudding, causing the chocolate to melt and create an explosively delicious sensation in my mouth.

Complementing our meal, we enjoyed a bottle of wine selected from an impressive collection. The waitstaff was attentive and provided impeccable service, ensuring our dining experience was nothing short of exceptional.

In summary, the food at the restaurant was top-notch, and our waiter went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction. The combination of delectable dishes, remarkable views, and impeccable service made this dining experience truly unforgettable.

I would recommend this place to anyone who wants fresh seafood and a great view. I would also recommend this place to anyone who wants to try fresh seafood.

I had the seafood special which was a steamed 3-lb. crab served with a salad and soup for $26. I thought this was quite the steal because the crab was huge, delicious and meaty. The garden salad was fresh as simple as it was. The lobster bisque we got was pretty good. (The other options were Caesar salad and clam chowder). They topped off the crab with a couple of onion rings and cups of cocktail sauce and drawn butter. Yum!

We also got the fried platter of shrimp, oysters, calamari and scallops for $12.95. It came with cole slaw, onion rings, tartar sauce and cocktail sauce. As greasy of a meal as this made, it was one of the better fried platters I've

I highly recommend this place for anyone seeking both fresh seafood and a breathtaking view. In addition, it is an excellent choice for those wanting to savor the taste of fresh seafood.

During my visit, I indulged in the seafood special which consisted of a generously sized, scrumptious 3-lb. crab accompanied by a flavorsome salad and soup, all for just $26. This offering was an absolute steal, considering the crab was not only massive but also incredibly delectable and packed with succulent meat. The garden salad, although simple, was delightfully fresh. The lobster bisque we ordered was also quite enjoyable, with the alternative options being Caesar salad and clam chowder. The meal was further enhanced by the delightful presence of a few onion rings and servings of both cocktail sauce and drawn butter, enhancing the flavors of the crab. Simply divine!

We also decided to try the fried platter, which featured shrimp, oysters, calamari, and scallops, all expertly fried and served at a reasonable price of $12.95. This dish was accompanied by cole slaw, onion rings, tartar sauce, and cocktail sauce. Despite being a slightly greasy affair, it was definitely one of the more exemplary fried platters I have had the pleasure of experiencing.

input:
I was happy his was my first experience with Nola food and not my last, started on a low point.
